akn:section.akn:heading: Transportation of mail by vessel as freight or express

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 5603. Transportation of mail by vessel as freight or express The Postal Service may require that mail be transported by freight or express when—(1) there is no competition on a water route and the rate or compensation asked is excessive; or
(2) no proposal is received.
A common carrier by water that fails or refuses to transport the mail when required to do so under this section shall be fined not more than $500 for each day of refusal. (Pub. L. 91–375, Aug. 12, 1970, 84 Stat. 773.)
